post.description:
Create a new [Primary IP](#primary-ips).

Can optionally be assigned to a resource by providing an `assignee_id` and `assignee_type`.
 
If not assigned to a resource the `datacenter` key needs to be provided. This can be either the ID or the name of the [Datacenter](#datacenters) this [Primary IP](#primary-ips) shall be created in.

A [Primary IP](#primary-ips) can only be assigned to resource in the same [Datacenter](#datacenters) later on.

#### Call specific error codes

| Code                          | Description                                                              |
 |------------------------------ |------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| `server_not_stopped`          | The specified [Server](#servers) is running, but needs to be powered off |
| `server_has_ipv4`             | The [Server](#servers) already has an ipv4 address                       |
| `server_has_ipv6`             | The [Server](#servers) already has an ipv6 address                       |

requestBody.description:
Request Body for creating a new [Primary IP](#primary-ips).
 
The `datacenter` and `assignee_id`/`assignee_type` attributes are mutually exclusive.

name.description: Name of the Resource. Must be unique per Project.

labels.description:
User-defined labels (`key/value` pairs) for the Resource.
 For more information, see "[Labels](#labels)".

datacenter.description:
[Datacenter](#datacenters) ID or name.

The  [Primary IP](#primary-ips) will be bound to this [Datacenter](#datacenters). Omit if `assignee_id`/`assignee_type` is provided.

assignee_type.description:
Type of resource the [Primary IP](#primary-ips) can get assigned to.

Currently [Primary IPs](#primary-ips) can only be assigned to [Servers](#servers),
therefore this field must be set to `server`.

assignee_id.description:
ID of resource to assign the [Primary IP](#primary-ips) to.

Omitted if the [Primary IP](#primary-ips) should not get assigned.

auto_delete.description:
Auto deletion state.

If enabled the [Primary IP](#primary-ips) will be deleted once the assigned resource gets deleted.

201.description:
Response for creating a [Primary IP](#primary-ips).

Contains the newly created [Primary IP](#primary-ips).

x-codeSamples.label: Go

x-codeSamples.source:
from __future__ import annotations

from os import environ

 from hcloud import Client

token = environ["HCLOUD_TOKEN"]
client = Client(token=token)

response = client.primary_ips.create(
    assignee_id=17,
    assignee_type="server",
    auto_delete=False,
    datacenter="fsn1-dc8",
    labels={
        "environment": "prod",
        "example.com/my": "label",
        "just-a-key": "",
    },
    name="my-resource",
    type="ipv4",
)

response.action.wait_until_finished()
 
primary_ip = response.primary_ip
x-codeSamples.label: Python

x-codeSamples.source:
hcloud primary-ip create \
    --assignee-id 17 \
    --auto-delete=false \
    --datacenter fsn1-dc8 \
    --label "environment=prod" \
    --label "example.com/my=label" \
    --label "just-a-key=" \
    --name my-ip \
    --type ipv4

post.summary: Assign a Primary IP to a resource
post.description:
Assign a [Primary IP](#primary-ips) to a resource.

A [Server](#servers) can only have one [Primary IP](#primary-ips) of type `ipv4` and one of type `ipv6` assigned. If you need more IPs use [Floating IPs](#floating-ips).
 
A [Server](#servers) must be powered off (status `off`) in order for this operation to succeed.

#### Error Codes specific to this Call

| Code                          | Description                                                                      |
|------------------------------ |--------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| `server_not_stopped`          | The [Server](#servers) is running, but needs to be powered off                   |
| `primary_ip_already_assigned` | [Primary IP](#primary-ips) is already assigned to a different [Server](#servers) |
| `server_has_ipv4`             | The [Server](#servers) already has an IPv4 address                               |
| `server_has_ipv6`             | The [Server](#servers) already has an IPv6 address                               |

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the Primary IP.

assignee_type.description: Type of resource assigning the Primary IP to

assignee_id.description: ID of a resource of type `assignee_type`

201.description:
Response for assigning a [Primary IP](#primary-ips).

Contains an [Action](#actions) of type `assign_primary_ip`.

started.description: Point in time when the Action was started (in ISO-8601 format).

finished.description: Point in time when the Action was finished (in ISO-8601 format). Only set if the Action is finished otherwise null.

progress.description: Progress of the Action in percent.

error.description: Error message for the Action if an error occurred, otherwise null.

x-codeSamples.label: Go

x-codeSamples.source:
from __future__ import annotations

from os import environ

 from hcloud import Client
from hcloud.primary_ips import PrimaryIP

 token = environ["HCLOUD_TOKEN"]
client = Client(token=token)

action = client.primary_ips.assign(
    primary_ip=PrimaryIP(id=123),
    assignee_id=4711,
    assignee_type="server",
)

action.wait_until_finished()
x-codeSamples.label: Python

x-codeSamples.source: hcloud primary-ip assign --server 4711 $PRIMARYIP
x-codeSamples.label: CLI

post.summary: Change reverse DNS records for a Primary IP
post.description:
Change the reverse DNS records for this [Primary IP](#primary-ips).
 
Allows to modify the PTR records set for the IP address.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the Primary IP.

requestBody.description:
The `ip` attributes specifies for which IP address the record is set. For IPv4 addresses this must be the exact address of the [Primary IP](#primary-ips). For IPv6 addresses this must be a single address within the `/64` subnet of the [Primary IP](#primary-ips).

The `dns_ptr` attribute specifies the hostname used for the IP address.

For IPv6 [Floating IPs](#floating-ips) up to 100 entries can be created.

ip.description: Single IPv4 or IPv6 address to create pointer for.

dns_ptr.description:
Domain Name to point to.

PTR record content used for reverse DNS.

201.description:
Response for changing a [Primary IPs](#primary-ips) DNS pointer.
 
Contains an [Action](#actions) of type `change_dns_ptr`.

started.description: Point in time when the Action was started (in ISO-8601 format).

finished.description: Point in time when the Action was finished (in ISO-8601 format). Only set if the Action is finished otherwise null.

progress.description: Progress of the Action in percent.

error.description: Error message for the Action if an error occurred, otherwise null.

x-codeSamples.label: Go

x-codeSamples.source:
from __future__ import annotations

from os import environ

 from hcloud import Client
from hcloud.primary_ips import PrimaryIP

 token = environ["HCLOUD_TOKEN"]
client = Client(token=token)

action = client.primary_ips.change_dns_ptr(
    primary_ip=PrimaryIP(id=123),
    dns_ptr="server.example.com",
    ip="2001:db8::1",
)

action.wait_until_finished()
x-codeSamples.label: Python

x-codeSamples.source:
hcloud primary-ip set-rdns $PRIMARYIP \
    --ip 1.2.3.4 \
    --hostname server02.example.com
x-codeSamples.label: CLI

A [Primary IPs](#primary-ips) deletion protection can only be enabled if its `auto_delete` property is set to `false`.

delete.description: Prevent the Resource from being deleted.

progress.description: Progress of the Action in percent.

error.description: Error message for the Action if an error occurred, otherwise null.

from os import environ

 from hcloud import Client
from hcloud.primary_ips import PrimaryIP

 token = environ["HCLOUD_TOKEN"]
client = Client(token=token)

action = client.primary_ips.change_protection(

    delete=False,

action.wait_until_finished()

post.summary: Unassign a Primary IP from a resource
post.description:
Unassign a [Primary IP](#primary-ips) from a resource.

A [Server](#servers) must be powered off (status `off`) in order for this operation to succeed.
 
A [Server](#server) requires at least one network interface (public or private) to be powered on.

#### Error Codes specific to this Call

| Code                              | Description                                                   |
|---------------------------------- |-------------------------------------------------------------- |
| `server_not_stopped`              | The [Server](#server) is running, but needs to be powered off |
| `server_is_load_balancer_target`  | The [Server](#server) IPv4 address is a loadbalancer target   |

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the Primary IP.

finished.description: Point in time when the Action was finished (in ISO-8601 format). Only set if the Action is finished otherwise null.

progress.description: Progress of the Action in percent.

error.description: Error message for the Action if an error occurred, otherwise null.

post.description: Creates a new Server. Returns preliminary information about the Server as well as an Action that covers progress of creation.

requestBody.description:
Please note that Server names must be unique per Project and valid hostnames as per RFC 1123 (i.e. may only contain letters, digits, periods, and dashes).

For `server_type` you can either use the ID as listed in `/server_types` or its name.

For `image` you can either use the ID as listed in `/images` or its name.

If you want to create the Server in a Location, you must set `location` to the ID or name as listed in `/locations`. This is the recommended way. You can be even more specific by setting `datacenter` to the ID or name as listed in `/datacenters`. However we only recommend this if you want to assign a specific Primary IP to the Server which is located in the specified Datacenter.

Some properties like `start_after_create` or `automount` will trigger Actions after the Server is created. Those Actions are listed in the `next_actions` field in the response.

For accessing your Server we strongly recommend to use SSH keys by passing the respective key IDs in `ssh_keys`. If you do not specify any `ssh_keys` we will generate a root password for you and return it in the response.

Please note that provided user-data is stored in our systems. While we take measures to protect it we highly recommend that you don’t use it to store passwords or other sensitive information.

 #### Call specific error codes

| Code                             | Description                                                |
|----------------------------------|------------------------------------------------------------|
 | `placement_error`                | An error during the placement occurred                     |
| `primary_ip_assigned`            | The specified Primary IP is already assigned to a server   |
| `primary_ip_datacenter_mismatch` | The specified Primary IP is in a different datacenter      |
| `primary_ip_version_mismatch`    | The specified Primary IP has the wrong IP Version          |

location.description: ID or name of Location to create Server in (must not be used together with datacenter)

datacenter.description: ID or name of Datacenter to create Server in (must not be used together with location)

server_type.description: ID or name of the Server type this Server should be created with

start_after_create.description: This automatically triggers a [Power on a Server-Server Action](#server-actions-power-on-a-server) after the creation is finished and is returned in the `next_actions` response object.

image.description: ID or name of the Image the Server is created from

volumes.description: Volume IDs which should be attached to the Server at the creation time. Volumes must be in the same Location.

x-codeSamples.label: Go

x-codeSamples.source:
from __future__ import annotations

from os import environ

 from hcloud import Client
from hcloud.firewalls import Firewall
from hcloud.images import Image
from hcloud.locations import Location
from hcloud.networks import Network
from hcloud.placement_groups import PlacementGroup
from hcloud.server_types import ServerType
from hcloud.servers import ServerCreatePublicNetwork
 from hcloud.ssh_keys import SSHKey
from hcloud.volumes import Volume

 token = environ["HCLOUD_TOKEN"]
client = Client(token=token)

response = client.servers.create(
    automount=False,
    datacenter="nbg1-dc3",
    firewalls=[Firewall(id=38)],
    image=Image(name="ubuntu-20.04"),
    labels={
        "environment": "prod",
        "example.com/my": "label",
        "just-a-key": "",
    },
    location=Location(name="nbg1"),
    name="my-server",
    networks=[Network(id=456)],
    placement_group=PlacementGroup(id=1),
    public_net=ServerCreatePublicNetwork(
        enable_ipv4=False,
        enable_ipv6=False,
        ipv4=None,
        ipv6=None,
    ),
    server_type=ServerType(name="cpx11"),
    ssh_keys=[SSHKey(name="my-ssh-key")],
    start_after_create=True,
    user_data="#cloud-config\nruncmd:\n- [touch, /root/cloud-init-worked]\n",
    volumes=[Volume(id=123)],
)

response.action.wait_until_finished()
 
server = response.server
x-codeSamples.label: Python

x-codeSamples.source:
hcloud server create \
    --automount=false \
    --datacenter nbg1-dc3 \
    --firewall 38 \
    --image ubuntu-20.04 \
    --label "environment=prod" \
    --label "example.com/my=label" \
    --label "just-a-key=" \
    --location nbg1 \
    --name my-server \
    --network 456 \
    --placement-group 1 \
    --without-ipv4 \
    --without-ipv6 \
    --type cx22 \
    --ssh-key my-ssh-key \
    --start-after-create \
    --volume 123 \
    --user-data-from-file <(printf '#cloud-config\nruncmd:\n- [touch, /root/cloud-init-worked]\n')

x-codeSamples.label: Go

x-codeSamples.source:
from __future__ import annotations

from os import environ

 from hcloud import Client
from hcloud.servers import Server

token = environ["HCLOUD_TOKEN"]
client = Client(token=token)

server = client.servers.update(
    server=Server(id=123),
    labels={
        "environment": "prod",
        "example.com/my": "label",
        "just-a-key": "",
    },
    name="my-server",
)
x-codeSamples.label: Python

x-codeSamples.source:
hcloud server update $SERVER --name "my-server"
hcloud server add-label --overwrite $SERVER \
    "environment=prod" "example.com/my=label" "just-a-key="
x-codeSamples.label: CLI

delete.description:
Deletes a Server.

This immediately removes the Server from your account, and it is no longer
accessible. Any resources attached to the server (like Volumes, Primary IPs,
Floating IPs, Firewalls, Placement Groups) are detached while the server is deleted.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the Server.

200.description: The `action` key in the reply contains an Action object with this structure

started.description: Point in time when the Action was started (in ISO-8601 format).

finished.description: Point in time when the Action was finished (in ISO-8601 format). Only set if the Action is finished otherwise null.

progress.description: Progress of the Action in percent.

error.description: Error message for the Action if an error occurred, otherwise null.

 from hcloud import Client
from hcloud.servers import Server

token = environ["HCLOUD_TOKEN"]

action = client.servers.delete(
    server=Server(id=123),
)

action.wait_until_finished()
x-codeSamples.label: Python

x-codeSamples.source: hcloud server delete $SERVER
x-codeSamples.label: CLI

get.summary: Get all Actions for a Server
get.description: Returns all Action objects for a Server. You can `sort` the results by using the sort URI parameter, and filter them with the `status` parameter.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the Server.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Sort actions by field and direction. Can be used multiple times. For more
information, see "[Sorting](#sorting)".

parameters.name: status
parameters.description:
Filter the actions by status. Can be used multiple times. The response will only
contain actions matching the specified statuses.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number to return. For more information, see "[Pagination](#pagination)".

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Maximum number of entries returned per page. For more information, see "[Pagination](#pagination)".

200.description: The `actions` key contains a list of Actions

started.description: Point in time when the Action was started (in ISO-8601 format).

finished.description: Point in time when the Action was finished (in ISO-8601 format). Only set if the Action is finished otherwise null.

progress.description: Progress of the Action in percent.

error.description: Error message for the Action if an error occurred, otherwise null.

per_page.description: Maximum number of entries returned per page.

previous_page.description: Page number of the previous page. Can be null if the current page is the first one.

next_page.description: Page number of the next page. Can be null if the current page is the last one.

last_page.description: Page number of the last page available. Can be null if the current page is the last one.

total_entries.description: Total number of entries that exist for this query. Can be null if unknown.

post.summary: Add a Server to a Placement Group
post.description:
Adds a Server to a Placement Group.

Server must be powered off for this command to succeed.

#### Call specific error codes

| Code                          | Description                                                          |
|-------------------------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------|
 | `server_not_stopped`          | The action requires a stopped server                                 |

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the Server.

placement_group.description: ID of Placement Group the Server should be added to

201.description: The `action` key in the reply contains an Action object with this structure

started.description: Point in time when the Action was started (in ISO-8601 format).

finished.description: Point in time when the Action was finished (in ISO-8601 format). Only set if the Action is finished otherwise null.

progress.description: Progress of the Action in percent.

error.description: Error message for the Action if an error occurred, otherwise null.

x-codeSamples.label: Go

x-codeSamples.source:
from __future__ import annotations

from os import environ

 from hcloud import Client
from hcloud.placement_groups import PlacementGroup
 from hcloud.servers import Server

token = environ["HCLOUD_TOKEN"]
 client = Client(token=token)

action = client.servers.add_to_placement_group(
    server=Server(id=123), placement_group=PlacementGroup(id=1)
)

action.wait_until_finished()
x-codeSamples.label: Python

x-codeSamples.source: hcloud server add-to-placement-group --placement-group 1 $SERVER
x-codeSamples.label: CLI

post.summary: Attach an ISO to a Server
post.description:
Attaches an ISO to a Server. The Server will immediately see it as a new disk. An already attached ISO will automatically be detached before the new ISO is attached.

Servers with attached ISOs have a modified boot order: They will try to boot from the ISO first before falling back to hard disk.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the Server.

iso.description: ID or name of ISO to attach to the Server as listed in GET `/isos`

201.description: The `action` key in the reply contains an Action object with this structure

started.description: Point in time when the Action was started (in ISO-8601 format).

finished.description: Point in time when the Action was finished (in ISO-8601 format). Only set if the Action is finished otherwise null.

progress.description: Progress of the Action in percent.

error.description: Error message for the Action if an error occurred, otherwise null.

x-codeSamples.label: Go

x-codeSamples.source:
from __future__ import annotations

from os import environ

 from hcloud import Client
from hcloud.isos import Iso
from hcloud.servers import Server

token = environ["HCLOUD_TOKEN"]
client = Client(token=token)
 
action = client.servers.attach_iso(
    server=Server(id=123), iso=Iso(name="FreeBSD-11.0-RELEASE-amd64-dvd1")
)

action.wait_until_finished()
x-codeSamples.label: Python

x-codeSamples.source: hcloud server attach-iso $SERVER "FreeBSD-11.0-RELEASE-amd64-dvd1"
x-codeSamples.label: CLI

post.summary: Attach a Server to a Network
post.description:
Attaches a Server to a network. This will complement the fixed public Server interface by adding an additional ethernet interface to the Server which is connected to the specified network.

The Server will get an IP auto assigned from a subnet of type `server` in the same `network_zone`.
 
Using the `alias_ips` attribute you can also define one or more additional IPs to the Servers. Please note that you will have to configure these IPs by hand on your Server since only the primary IP will be given out by DHCP.
 
**Call specific error codes**

| Code                             | Description                                                           |
|----------------------------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------|
 | `server_already_attached`        | The server is already attached to the network                         |
| `ip_not_available`               | The provided Network IP is not available                              |
| `no_subnet_available`            | No Subnet or IP is available for the Server within the network        |
| `networks_overlap`               | The network IP range overlaps with one of the server networks         |

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the Server.

network.description: ID of an existing network to attach the Server to

ip.description: IP to request to be assigned to this Server; if you do not provide this then you will be auto assigned an IP address

alias_ips.description: Additional IPs to be assigned to this Server

201.description: The `action` key in the reply contains an Action object with this structure

started.description: Point in time when the Action was started (in ISO-8601 format).

finished.description: Point in time when the Action was finished (in ISO-8601 format). Only set if the Action is finished otherwise null.

progress.description: Progress of the Action in percent.

error.description: Error message for the Action if an error occurred, otherwise null.

x-codeSamples.label: Go

x-codeSamples.source:
from __future__ import annotations

from os import environ

 from hcloud import Client
from hcloud.networks import Network
from hcloud.servers import Server

token = environ["HCLOUD_TOKEN"]
client = Client(token=token)
 
action = client.servers.attach_to_network(
    server=Server(id=123),
    alias_ips=["10.0.1.2"],
    ip="10.0.1.1",
    network=Network(id=4711),
)

action.wait_until_finished()
x-codeSamples.label: Python

x-codeSamples.source:
hcloud server attach-to-network $SERVER \
    --alias-ips 10.0.1.2 \
    --ip 10.0.1.1 \
    --network 4711
x-codeSamples.label: CLI

post.summary: Change alias IPs of a Network
post.description: Changes the alias IPs of an already attached Network. Note that the existing aliases for the specified Network will be replaced with these provided in the request body. So if you want to add an alias IP, you have to provide the existing ones from the Network plus the new alias IP in the request body.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the Server.

network.description: ID of an existing Network already attached to the Server

alias_ips.description: New alias IPs to set for this Server

201.description: The `action` key in the reply contains an Action object with this structure

started.description: Point in time when the Action was started (in ISO-8601 format).

finished.description: Point in time when the Action was finished (in ISO-8601 format). Only set if the Action is finished otherwise null.

progress.description: Progress of the Action in percent.

error.description: Error message for the Action if an error occurred, otherwise null.

from __future__ import annotations

from os import environ

 from hcloud import Client
from hcloud.networks import Network
from hcloud.servers import Server

token = environ["HCLOUD_TOKEN"]
client = Client(token=token)
 
action = client.servers.change_alias_ips(
    server=Server(id=123),
    alias_ips=["10.0.1.2"],
    network=Network(id=4711),
)

action.wait_until_finished()

hcloud server change-alias-ips $SERVER \
    --alias-ips 10.0.1.2 \
    --network 4711

post.summary: Change reverse DNS entry for this Server
post.description:
Changes the hostname that will appear when getting the hostname belonging to the primary IPs (IPv4 and IPv6) of this Server.

Floating IPs assigned to the Server are not affected by this.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the Server.

requestBody.description: Select the IP address for which to change the DNS entry by passing `ip`. It can be either IPv4 or IPv6. The target hostname is set by passing `dns_ptr`.

post.summary: Change the Type of a Server
post.description:
Changes the type (Cores, RAM and disk sizes) of a Server.

 Server must be powered off for this command to succeed.

This copies the content of its disk, and starts it again.

You can only migrate to Server types with the same `storage_type` and equal or bigger disks. Shrinking disks is not possible as it might destroy data.

If the disk gets upgraded, the Server type can not be downgraded any more. If you plan to downgrade the Server type, set `upgrade_disk` to `false`.

#### Call specific error codes

 | Code                          | Description                                                          |
|-------------------------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------|
 | `invalid_server_type`         | The server type does not fit for the given server or is deprecated   |
| `server_not_stopped`          | The action requires a stopped server                                 |

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the Server.

upgrade_disk.description: If false, do not upgrade the disk (this allows downgrading the Server type later)

server_type.description: ID or name of Server type the Server should migrate to

201.description: The `action` key in the reply contains an Action object with this structure

started.description: Point in time when the Action was started (in ISO-8601 format).

finished.description: Point in time when the Action was finished (in ISO-8601 format). Only set if the Action is finished otherwise null.

progress.description: Progress of the Action in percent.

error.description: Error message for the Action if an error occurred, otherwise null.

x-codeSamples.label: Go

x-codeSamples.source:
from __future__ import annotations

from os import environ

 from hcloud import Client
from hcloud.server_types import ServerType
 from hcloud.servers import Server

token = environ["HCLOUD_TOKEN"]
 client = Client(token=token)

action = client.servers.change_type(
    server=Server(id=123),
    server_type=ServerType(name="cpx11"),
    upgrade_disk=True,
)

action.wait_until_finished()
x-codeSamples.label: Python

x-codeSamples.source: hcloud server change-type --keep-disk $SERVER cx22
x-codeSamples.label: CLI

post.description:
Creates an Image (snapshot) from a Server by copying the contents of its disks. This creates a snapshot of the current state of the disk and copies it into an Image. If the Server is currently running you must make sure that its disk content is consistent. Otherwise, the created Image may not be readable.

To make sure disk content is consistent, we recommend to shut down the Server prior to creating an Image.

You can either create a `backup` Image that is bound to the Server and therefore will be deleted when the Server is deleted, or you can create a `snapshot` Image which is completely independent of the Server it was created from and will survive Server deletion. Backup Images are only available when the backup option is enabled for the Server. Snapshot Images are billed on a per GB basis.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the Server.

description.description: Description of the Image, will be auto-generated if not set

labels.description:
User-defined labels (`key/value` pairs) for the Resource.
 For more information, see "[Labels](#labels)".

201.description:
The `image` key in the reply contains an the created Image, which is an object with this structure

The `action` key in the reply contains an Action object with this structure

status.description: Whether the Image can be used or if it's still being created or unavailable

name.description: Unique identifier of the Image. This value is only set for system Images.

image_size.description: Size of the Image file in our storage in GB. For snapshot Images this is the value relevant for calculating costs for the Image.

disk_size.description: Size of the disk contained in the Image in GB

created.description: Point in time when the Resource was created (in ISO-8601 format).

id.description: ID of the Server the Image was created from

name.description: Server name at the time the Image was created

created_from.description: Information about the Server the Image was created from

bound_to.description: ID of Server the Image is bound to. Only set for Images of type `backup`.

os_flavor.description: Flavor of operating system contained in the Image

rapid_deploy.description: Indicates that rapid deploy of the Image is available

delete.description: Prevent the Resource from being deleted.

deprecated.description: Point in time when the Image is considered to be deprecated (in ISO-8601 format)

deleted.description: Point in time where the Image was deleted (in ISO-8601 format)

labels.description:
User-defined labels (`key/value` pairs) for the Resource.
For more information, see "[Labels](#labels)".

architecture.description: CPU architecture compatible with the Image.

started.description: Point in time when the Action was started (in ISO-8601 format).

finished.description: Point in time when the Action was finished (in ISO-8601 format). Only set if the Action is finished otherwise null.

progress.description: Progress of the Action in percent.

error.description: Error message for the Action if an error occurred, otherwise null.

 from hcloud import Client

token = environ["HCLOUD_TOKEN"]

post.summary: Enable Rescue Mode for a Server
post.description:
Enable the Hetzner Rescue System for this Server. The next time a Server with enabled rescue mode boots it will start a special minimal Linux distribution designed for repair and reinstall.

In case a Server cannot boot on its own you can use this to access a Server’s disks.

Rescue Mode is automatically disabled when you first boot into it or if you do not use it for 60 minutes.

Enabling rescue mode will not [reboot](https://docs.hetzner.cloud/#server-actions-soft-reboot-a-server) your Server — you will have to do this yourself.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the Server.

type.description: Type of rescue system to boot.

ssh_keys.description: Array of SSH key IDs which should be injected into the rescue system.

201.description:
The `root_password` key in the reply contains the root password that can be used to access the booted rescue system.

The `action` key in the reply contains an Action object with this structure

root_password.description: Password that will be set for this Server once the Action succeeds

started.description: Point in time when the Action was started (in ISO-8601 format).

finished.description: Point in time when the Action was finished (in ISO-8601 format). Only set if the Action is finished otherwise null.

progress.description: Progress of the Action in percent.

error.description: Error message for the Action if an error occurred, otherwise null.

The Image can either be one you have created earlier (`backup` or `snapshot` Image) or it can be a completely fresh `system` Image provided by us. You can get a list of all available Images with `GET /images`.

Your Server will automatically be powered off before the rebuild command executes.

get.description: Returns a specific Action object for a Server.

parameters.name: id

parameters.name: action_id
parameters.description: ID of the Action.

200.description: The `action` key in the reply has this structure

started.description: Point in time when the Action was started (in ISO-8601 format).

progress.description: Progress of the Action in percent.

get.description:
Get Metrics for specified Server.

You must specify the type of metric to get: cpu, disk or network. You can also specify more than one type by comma separation, e.g. cpu,disk.

Depending on the type you will get different time series data

| Type    | Timeseries              | Unit      | Description                                          |
|---------|-------------------------|-----------|------------------------------------------------------|
 | cpu     | cpu                     | percent   | Percent CPU usage                                    |
| disk    | disk.0.iops.read        | iop/s     | Number of read IO operations per second              |
|         | disk.0.iops.write       | iop/s     | Number of write IO operations per second             |
|         | disk.0.bandwidth.read   | bytes/s   | Bytes read per second                                |
|         | disk.0.bandwidth.write  | bytes/s   | Bytes written per second                             |
 | network | network.0.pps.in        | packets/s | Public Network interface packets per second received |
|         | network.0.pps.out       | packets/s | Public Network interface packets per second sent     |
|         | network.0.bandwidth.in  | bytes/s   | Public Network interface bytes/s received            |
|         | network.0.bandwidth.out | bytes/s   | Public Network interface bytes/s sent                |

Metrics are available for the last 30 days only.

If you do not provide the step argument we will automatically adjust it so that a maximum of 200 samples are returned.

We limit the number of samples returned to a maximum of 500 and will adjust the step parameter accordingly.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the Server.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of metrics to get

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Start of period to get Metrics for (in ISO-8601 format)

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: End of period to get Metrics for (in ISO-8601 format)

parameters.name: step
parameters.description: Resolution of results in seconds

200.description: The `metrics` key in the reply contains a metrics object with this structure

start.description: Start of period of metrics reported (in ISO-8601 format)

end.description: End of period of metrics reported (in ISO-8601 format)

time_series.description: Hash with timeseries information, containing the name of timeseries as key

x-codeSamples.label: Go

x-codeSamples.source:
from __future__ import annotations

from os import environ
import datetime

from hcloud import Client
from hcloud.servers import Server
 
token = environ["HCLOUD_TOKEN"]
client = Client(token=token)

response = client.servers.get_metrics(
	server=Server(id=123),
	start=datetime.datetime(2017, 1, 1, 0, 0, 0, 0, datetime.UTC),
	end=datetime.datetime(2017, 1, 1, 23, 0, 0, 0, datetime.UTC),
	step=60,
	type=[
		"cpu",
		"network",
		"disk",
	]
)

response.action.wait_until_finished()

metrics = response.metrics
x-codeSamples.label: Python

x-codeSamples.source:
hcloud server metrics $SERVER \
    --type cpu,network,disk \
    --start 2017-01-01T00:00:00Z \
    --end 2017-01-01T23:00:00Z

post.description:
Creates a new Volume attached to a Server. If you want to create a Volume that is not attached to a Server, you need to provide the `location` key instead of `server`. This can be either the ID or the name of the Location this Volume will be created in. Note that a Volume can be attached to a Server only in the same Location as the Volume itself.

Specifying the Server during Volume creation will automatically attach the Volume to that Server after it has been initialized. In that case, the `next_actions` key in the response is an array which contains a single `attach_volume` action.

The minimum Volume size is 10GB and the maximum size is 10TB (10240GB).

A volume’s name can consist of alphanumeric characters, dashes, underscores, and dots, but has to start and end with an alphanumeric character. The total length is limited to 64 characters. Volume names must be unique per Project.

 #### Call specific error codes

| Code                                | Description                                         |
|-------------------------------------|-----------------------------------------------------|
 | `no_space_left_in_location`         | There is no volume space left in the given location |

size.description: Size of the Volume in GB

name.description: Name of the volume

labels.description:
User-defined labels (`key/value` pairs) for the Resource.
 For more information, see "[Labels](#labels)".

automount.description: Auto-mount Volume after attach. `server` must be provided.

format.description: Format Volume after creation. One of: `xfs`, `ext4`

location.description: Location to create the Volume in (can be omitted if Server is specified)

server.description: Server to which to attach the Volume once it's created (Volume will be created in the same Location as the server)

201.description:
The `volume` key contains the Volume that was just created
 
The `action` key contains the Action tracking Volume creation

 from hcloud import Client

client = Client(token=token)

response = client.volumes.create(
    automount=False,
    format="xfs",
    labels={"key": "value"},

)

from hcloud.servers import Server

token = environ["HCLOUD_TOKEN"]
client = Client(token=token)
 
action = client.volumes.attach(
    volume=Volume(id=123),
    automount=False,
    server=Server(id=43),
)

action.wait_until_finished()
x-codeSamples.label: Python

x-codeSamples.source:
hcloud volume attach $VOLUME \
    --automount=false \
    --server 43
x-codeSamples.label: CLI

post.description: Changes the protection configuration of a Volume.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the Volume.

delete.description: If true, prevents the Volume from being deleted

201.description: The `action` key contains the `change_protection` Action

started.description: Point in time when the Action was started (in ISO-8601 format).

finished.description: Point in time when the Action was finished (in ISO-8601 format). Only set if the Action is finished otherwise null.

progress.description: Progress of the Action in percent.

error.description: Error message for the Action if an error occurred, otherwise null.

x-codeSamples.label: Go

x-codeSamples.source:
from __future__ import annotations

from os import environ

 from hcloud import Client
from hcloud.volumes import Volume

token = environ["HCLOUD_TOKEN"]
client = Client(token=token)

action = client.volumes.change_protection(
    volume=Volume(id=123),
    delete=True,
)

action.wait_until_finished()
x-codeSamples.label: Python

x-codeSamples.source: hcloud volume enable-protection $VOLUME delete
x-codeSamples.label: CLI

post.description: Detaches a Volume from the Server it’s attached to. You may attach it to a Server again at a later time.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the Volume.

201.description: The `action` key contains the `detach_volume` Action

started.description: Point in time when the Action was started (in ISO-8601 format).

finished.description: Point in time when the Action was finished (in ISO-8601 format). Only set if the Action is finished otherwise null.

progress.description: Progress of the Action in percent.

error.description: Error message for the Action if an error occurred, otherwise null.

x-codeSamples.source:

 from hcloud import Client

post.description: Changes the size of a Volume. Note that downsizing a Volume is not possible.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the Volume.

size.description: New Volume size in GB (must be greater than current size)

201.description: The `action` key contains the `resize_volume` Action

started.description: Point in time when the Action was started (in ISO-8601 format).

finished.description: Point in time when the Action was finished (in ISO-8601 format). Only set if the Action is finished otherwise null.

progress.description: Progress of the Action in percent.

error.description: Error message for the Action if an error occurred, otherwise null.

x-codeSamples.label: Go

x-codeSamples.source:
from __future__ import annotations

from os import environ

 from hcloud import Client
from hcloud.volumes import Volume

token = environ["HCLOUD_TOKEN"]
client = Client(token=token)

action = client.volumes.resize(
    volume=Volume(id=123),
    size=50,

action.wait_until_finished()

get.summary: Get an Action for a Volume
get.description: Returns a specific Action for a Volume.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the Volume.

parameters.name: action_id
parameters.description: ID of the Action.

200.description: The `action` key contains the Volume Action

started.description: Point in time when the Action was started (in ISO-8601 format).

finished.description: Point in time when the Action was finished (in ISO-8601 format). Only set if the Action is finished otherwise null.

progress.description: Progress of the Action in percent.

error.description: Error message for the Action if an error occurred, otherwise null.
